entities.name: death
entities.description: Death is mentioned as a character who takes the first brother. ("And so Death took the first brother for his own.")

entities.name: the elder wand
entities.description: The Elder Wand is a powerful wand that was taken by the first brother from Death. ("with the Elder Wand as his weapon")

entities.name: the second brother
entities.description: The second brother is mentioned as having journeyed to his own home. ("Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his own home")

entities.name: the first brother
entities.description: The first brother is mentioned as being taken by Death and boasting of the Elder Wand. ("That very night, another wizard crept upon the older brother as he lay wine-sodden, upon his bed.")

entities.name: the third brother
entities.description: The third brother is not mentioned in this passage but is referred to in the title of the story. ("The Tale of the Three Brothers")

relationships.description: Death took the first brother for his own. ("And so Death took the first brother for his own.")
The first brother possessed the Elder Wand, which he used to win a duel. ("with the Elder Wand as his weapon")
The second brother journeyed to his own home. ("Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his own home")
